headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; A buses of the Drug Trade--The Fault with the People. State Teacher's Association. Joily Times at a School Meeting. The City Health and Mortulity. One Muzzled Dog and Loose Laws. Miscellanoous. POLICE INTELLIGENCE. Mad Dogs at Elizabeth. The Bible Union. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS--SPECIAL TERM. SUPREME COURT--SPECIAL TERM.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: An article appeared in your paper some time since under the heading of "Abuse in the Retail Drug Trade," to which I wish again to call attention, and that more for what the writer has left unsaid than for what he has actually written.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The John Street Methodist Church. The Fight gets into the Streets.

docs.lead_paragraph: The John-street Methodist Church still continues to be the scene of great excitement. Yesterday, from noon to midnight there was a crowd outside endeavoring to get possession and two separate parties inside, struggling each to possess for themselves and dispossess their neighbors.
docs.snippet: The John-street Methodist Church still continues to be the scene of great excitement. Yesterday, from noon to midnight there was a crowd outside endeavoring to get possession and two separate parties inside, struggling each to possess for themselves...

docs.lead_paragraph: The heavily-taxed subjects of Queen VICTOIFA sometimes console themselves with the argument that, if they hare to pay largely for the maintenance of the omamental appendiages of a Court and an aristocracy, the money is all spent among themselves, and paying it out in taxes is only taking out of one pocket and putting it in another.

headline.main: NEWS FROM VENEZUELA AND WEST INDIES.; Arrival of the Tennessee--Treaty Between the United States and Venezuela, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail Steamship Tennessee, CHARLES M. WEBBER. Commander, from Porto Cabello, Laguayra, St. Thomas and Porto Rico, arrived yesterday morning. The Tennessee left Porto Oabello on the 12th, and Laguayra on the 13th, and arrived at St. Thomas on the 16th took on board her passengers and freight, and left on the evening of the 17th for Porto Rico, where she arrived 5 A.M. the next morning.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is a translation of the ordinance by which the Christian soldiers in the East are permitted to follow their religion, secure from molestation: "We commend all general officers, colonels and other heads of those corps in our army which are Christian soldiers, to take care that they may observe their religion in perfect freedom.

headline.main: News from Havana--Arrival of the Philadelphia.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamship Philadelphia, J. McGOWAN commanding, arrived yesterday. The Philadelphia left New-Orleans 16th July, and Havana at 4 P. M. of the 19th for this port. The Philadelphia a landed 12 passengers and about $25,000 in specie at Havana, and brings 115 passengers and $200,000 in Mexican Silver for New-York.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Fled Hand and Foot--The O. U. A.'s blad the consciences of their Members. Columbia College. Paving Contracts--Effect of Inspectors Certificate. Aged Pasters. Decision in Admiralty. UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT. The Carmen on Living Out of Town. Erie Railroad Losses. Central Park Police, Hatfield Young Men's Association. The Slaver Braman Case. Medical Arrangements at Quarantine.

docs.lead_paragraph: The O. U. A.'s insist that their members must vote for FILLMORE or render themselves liable to expulsion. Some of the members may not have opened their eyes to this fact, but it is so, as every one will find on announcing his intention to vote for anybody else. Many in good and regular standing suppose that unless there is a Catholic in the case, they are at liberty to vote as their consciences dictate.

headline.main: ONE WEEK LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE PERSIA. PROGRESS OF THE CENTRAL AMERICAN QUESTION. Mr. Peabody's Fourth of July Dinner. How the Nomination of John C. Fremont is Received Abroad. Mutiny of the Tipperary Militia. Action with the Regulars and Loss of Life. RETURN OF THE GUARDS TO LONDON. MATTERS IN PARLIAMENT. Affairs in France. CRUEL TREATMENT OF POLITICAL PRISONERS IN NAPLES. Interesting from South America. Cotton Easier---Advance in Breadstuffs. Consols 95 3-4 a 95 7-8. THE CENTRAL AMERICA DISPUTE. Proposal to Cede Ruatan to Henduras--Probable Settlement of the Controverey. The Presidential Question Abroad--The Nomination of Fremoat MR. PEABODY'S ANNUAL DINNER. Fourth of July in London--Mr. Peabody's Annual Festival, &c. GREAT BRITAIN. Return of the Guards--Public Reception. Matters in Parliament. Mutiny of the Tipperary Milltia--Action with the Regulars--Less of Life. Accounts from the Frish Journals. The Case of Sadloir. Smith O'Brien at Home. AFFAIRS IN FRANCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The British and North American Man steamer Persia, from Liverpool soon after 3 o'clock P. M., on the 12th, arrived at this port early yesterday morning. The Arabia arrived at Liverpool at 9 1/2 o'clock P. M., of Saturday, July 6. The Ericsson arrived at Liverpool, morning of the 7th, whence she sailed for New-York at 1 P.. M., on the 10th, with five passengers.
docs.abstract: "Lond. Times" upon the condition of affairs
